physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient appeared older than his stated age, was prepubertal and had coarse facial features. His height and weight were significantly above the percentiles for his age.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Growth continued at an accelerated pace post-surgery, leading to significant increases in height as the patient grew.

vital_signs.fasting_growth_hormone: 235 g/L (suppressed to 29 g/L following glucose load)

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Elevated serum concentrations of prolactin, insulin-like growth factor-1 and growth hormone indicating pituitary gigantism with hyperprolactinaemia.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Following surgery, hormone concentrations remained elevated, with hyperplastic tissue re-expanding rapidly leading to continued accelerated growth.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Growth velocity normalized and IGF-1 remained within the normal range after treatment with cabergoline, octreotide, and pegvisomant.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Originally elevated hormone levels post-surgery improved with the addition of GH receptor antagonist resulting in stable pituitary volume.
